intro: Urostigma fagifolium, commonly known as the oak-leaved strobilant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble those of an oak tree. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Urostigma fagifolium is known for its ability to tolerate wet conditions, making it a common sight in riparian habitats.
